poem:
### The Great Cheese Heist

In the shadow of cities,  
where the curdled heart beats,  
a moonlit cheddar vanishes,  
silent as the night air;  
the thieves, specters  
in a maze of commerce.  
Jamie calls to arms,  
not against hunger,  
but for the restoration  
of what was drawn  
from the very soul of cows,  
wrapped in cloth and time.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jamie Oliver asks cheese lovers to help catch thieves behind £300,000 cheddar scam The celebrity chef Jamie Oliver has encouraged cheese lovers to help police catch scammers who defrauded a London dairy out of more than £300,000 worth of English and Welsh cheddar. Neal’s Yard Dairy, a distributor and retailer of British artisan cheese, delivered 22 tonnes of award-winning clothbound cheddar to the alleged fraudster posing as a wholesale distributor for a large French retailer". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
